laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: TSH levels decreased to 0.30 mU/L at 21 months of age, 1.18 mU/L at 7 years, and 1.16 mU/L at 8 years.
FT4 increased to 12.9 pmol/L at 21 months, 14.1 pmol/L at 7 years, and decreased to 2.1 pmol/L at 8 years after L-T4 withdrawal.
FT3 increased to 6.4 pmol/L at 21 months, decreased to 4.6 pmol/L at 7 years, and dropped to 1.5 pmol/L at 8 years.

laboratory_examinations.findings: a-GSU: 4.9 mg/L (normal range: 0.1–1.0 mg/L) at 75 days; increased to 9.4 mg/L at 21 months; further increased to 22.5 mg/L at 7 years.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Significantly elevated a-GSU levels were noted over time, indicating inadequate L-T4 therapy.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Basal PRL: 294 mU/L (normal range: 100–500 mU/L) at 21 months.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: PRL reached 508 mU/L (normal range: 100–500 mU/L) at age 8, indicating increased levels.
